DESCRIPTION: Reviews the different types of rational numbers and some of their properties: rational number, integer, natural number, whole number, non-integer, fraction, and irrational number. Also looks at symbols used in algebra and sets.
Overview of graphing opposite numbers, absolute values, additon/subtraction, and inequalities on number lines.

EIDs: MAT.ALG.144.L.1, MAT.ALG.130.L.1, MAT.ARI.110.L.1, MAT.ALG.142.1.L.1, MAT.ARI.410.L.1, MAT.ARI.420.L.1, MAT.ARI.430.L.1, MAT.ALG.154.1.L.1, MAT.ARI.440.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Introduces variable, variable expression, and variable equation. Reviews properties of real numbers (commutative, associative, additive identity, multiplicative identity, distributive) and the order of operations.

EIDs: MAT.ALG.210.L.1, MAT.ALG.220.L.1, MAT.ALG.244.L.1, MAT.ALG.246.L.1, MAT.ALG.250.L.1, MAT.ARI.600.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Looks at the properties of equality and solving linear equations in one variable. Also looks at the number of solutions to linear equations in one variable.
Looks at the properties of inequality and solving linear inequalities in one variable. Also looks at the number of solutions to linear inequalities in one variable and ways to write the solutions.
Overview of and/or compound inequalities: how to solve compound inequalities and how to plot the solutions on a number line.
Reviews how to solve absolute value equtions and inequalities.

EIDs: MAT.ALG.410.L.1, MAT.ALG.411.L.1, MAT.ALG.421.L.1, MAT.ALG.431.L.1, MAT.ALG.420.L.1, MAT.ALG.441.L.1, MAT.ALG.451.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Reviews coordinates on the coordinate plane and looks at basic concepts of functions (independent and dependent variables, domain and range).  Overview of graphing functions and the vertical line test.

EIDs: MAT.ALG.452.L.1, MAT.ALG.453.L.1, MAT.ALG.470.L.1, MAT.ALG.480.L.1, MAT.ALG.481.L.1, MAT.ALG.482.3.L.1, MAT.ALG.482.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Goes over the basics of graphing linear equations: slope, intercept, slope-intercept form, standard form, point-slope form, and converting between different forms of writing linear equations.

STUDY GUIDE NAME: Determining the Equation of a Line
EIDs: MAT.ALG.492.L.1, MAT.ALG.494.L.1, MAT.ALG.483.L.1, MAT.ALG.484.1.L.1, MAT.ALG.484.2.L.1, MAT.ALG.496.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Looks at finding equations for lines (in slope-intercept form, point-slope form, and standard form). Also looks at equations for parallel and perpendicular lines.

UNIT: Linear Systems of Equations and Inequalities
STUDY GUIDE NAME: Linear Systems: Solve by Graphing and Substitution
DESCRIPTION: Introduces systems of linear equations and how to solve by graphing and by substitution. Also looks at the types/number of solutions to systems of linear equations.

UNIT: Linear Systems of Equations and Inequalities
DESCRIPTION: Looks at solving systems of linear equations by adding/subtracting and by multiplying. Also provides guidelines for solving systems with 3 variables.

UNIT: Linear Systems of Equations and Inequalities
DESCRIPTION: Overview of graphing linear inequalities in one and two dimensions and graphing systems of inequalities.

Reviews properties of exponents and the exponential form: product rule, quotient rule, power rule for exponents, power rule for quotients. Also looks at how to evaluate zero, negative, and fractional exponents.
Looks at terminology for monomials and polynomials, operations with polynomials, FOIL, and special products (square of a binomial, sum and difference patterns).

EIDs: MAT.ALG.622.L.1, MAT.ALG.632.L.1, MAT.ALG.626.L.1, MAT.ALG.624.1.L.1, MAT.ALG.628.L.1, MAT.ALG.620.L.1
DESCRIPTION: A review of methods to factor polynomials, including identifying special products, factoring monomials, and tips for factoring polynomials completely. Also looks at how factoring can e used to solve polynomial equations.
A look at graphing quadratic functions and identifying features of the parabola. Also reviews how to solve quadratic functions by graphing.

EIDs: MAT.ALG.912.L.1, MAT.ALG.914.L.1, MAT.ALG.914.1.L.1, MAT.ALG.916.L.1, MAT.ALG.918.1.L.1, MAT.ALG.910.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Overview of methods to solve quadratic functions: solving by square roots (special case), completing the square, using the quadratic formula. Also looks at using the discriminant to determine the number of solutions.

EIDs: MAT.ALG.800.L.1, MAT.ALG.840.L.1, MAT.ALG.831.L.1, MAT.ALG.834.1.L.1, MAT.ALG.832.L.1, MAT.ALG.838.L.1
DESCRIPTION: A look at square and cube roots, radical expressions, rationalization, solving radical equations, and graphing radical functions and equations.
Compares linear, quadratic, and exponential models. Also looks at geometric sequences.
Looks at variations (direct, inverse, joint), graphing rational functions, and finding asymptotes.
Overview on simplifying rational expressions, solving rational equations, and removable zeros.
